intro: Alectra asperrima, commonly known as the rough Alectra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Alectra asperrima is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
